thread.title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger should have had ‘strong words’ with Aaron Ramsey after shock defeat to Watford, says Troy Deeney
thread.title_full: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger should have had ‘strong words’ with Aaron Ramsey after shock defeat to Watford, says Troy Deeney

author: jgordon
title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger should have had ‘strong words’ with Aaron Ramsey after shock defeat to Watford, says Troy Deeney
text:
But Gunners legend Thierry Henry is adamant that Wenger should not lose his job. 
He told RMC Sport : "Personally, I do not think Arsene has to go. Does he have to change his tactics or his way of doing things? 
"I do not know if he's willing to do that. What I saw against Chelsea is a mental problem, and it's not easy to manage. For now, something is missing. 
"It's been 12 years since Arsenal won the title and we feel this season they may not win it. I think there is quality in this team. But is there enough to win the title? Related Stories RAM BLOW Aaron Ramsey to be sidelined for at least THREE WEEKS with calf injury he picked up in Arsenal's loss to Watford You wat! Fights, car crashes, suspended jail term: meet M'Baye Niang, Watford's answer to Mario Balotelli, whose career includes a string of controversies... & even an encounter with a transvestite Heading hornets Watford 2 Burnley 1: Headers from Troy Deeney and M'Baye Niang sink ten-man Clarets we'll be ready Angry Arsenal will be ready to put things right after Watford disaster, Arsene Wenger warns Chelsea 'i'd be livid with him' Ian Wright calls Olivier Giroud's display 'the most pitiful 45 minutes I've ever seen from a centre-forward' 
"At the beginning of the season, when you look at Chelsea and Arsenal on paper, there is not a huge difference. 
"So that means it's possible. But for that, you have to be in tune with every day. I think Arsenal players are not aware of what they can achieve. 
"At some point you have to believe in your chances of winning. It takes self-management and self-discipline in the group."
